contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Rosoideae | image = Rosa eglanteria img 3218.jpg | image_caption = [[Sweetbrier]] (''[[Rosa eglanteria]]'') | regnum = [[Plant]]ae | unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] | unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] | unranked_ordo = [[Rosid]]s | ordo = [[Rosales]] | familia = [[Rosaceae]] | subfamilia = '''Rosoideae''' | subdivision_ranks = Genera | subdivision = About 35-40, see [[#Genera|text]] }} The [[rose]] subfamily '''Rosoideae''' consists of more than 850 [[species]], including many [[shrub]]s, perennial [[herb]]s, and fruit plants such as [[Fragaria|strawberries]] and [[bramble]]s. Only a few are annual herbs. The circumscription of the Rosoideae is still not wholly certain; recent genetic research<ref name=Eriksson>{{aut|Eriksson, T.; Hibbs, M.S.; Yoder, A.D.; Delwiche, C.F. & Donoghue, M.J.}} (2003): The Phylogeny of Rosoideae (Rosaceae) based on sequences of the internal transcribed spacers (ITS) of nuclear ribosomal DNA and the TRNL/F region of chloroplast DNA. ''[[International Journal of Plant Sciences|Int. J. Plant Sci.]]'' ''164''(2): 197–211. <small>{{doi|10.1086/346163}}</small> [http://www.biology.duke.edu/yoderlab/pdfs/2003,%20Eriksson%20et%20al,%20IJPS.pdf PDF fulltext]</ref> has resulted in several changes at the [[genus]] level and the removal from Rosoideae of some genera (notably ''[[Cercocarpus]], [[Cowania (plant)|Cowania]], [[Dryas (plant)|Dryas]], [[Purshia]]'') previously included in the subfamily. Further research is ongoing. ==Genera== <div float="left"> {{col-begin|width=70%}} {{col-1-of-2}} * ''[[Acaena]]'' – bidibids * ''[[Agrimonia]]'' – agrimonies * ''[[Alchemilla]]'' – lady's mantles * ''[[Aphanes]]'' – parsley-pierts (sometimes in ''Alchemilla''<ref name=potter>Potter, D., T. Eriksson, R. C. Evans, S.-H. Oh, J. E. E. Smedmark, D.R. Morgan, M. S. Kerr, and C. S. Campbell. (2007). Phylogeny and classification of Rosaceae. ''Plant Systematics and Evolution''. 266(1–2): 5–43.</ref>) * ''[[Aremonia]]'' * ''[[Argentina (plant)|Argentina]]'' – silverweeds (sometimes in ''Potentilla'') * ''[[Bencomia]]'' * ''[[Cliffortia]]'' * ''[[Chamaerhodos]]''<ref name=potter/> <small>Bunge</small> – Little-rose * ''[[Comarum]]'' (formerly in ''Potentilla'') * ''[[Dasiphora]]'' – woody cinquefoils (formerly in ''Potentilla'') * ''[[Dendriopoterium]]'' * ''[[Drymocallis]]'' – "sticky" cinquefoils (formerly in ''Potentilla'') * ''[[Fallugia]]''<ref name=potter/> * ''[[Filipendula]]'' * ''[[Fragaria]]'' – strawberries * ''[[Geum]]'' – "avenses" * ''[[Hagenia]]'' – African Redwood * ''[[Horkelia]]'' – horkelias (sometimes in ''Potentilla''<ref name=potter/>) * ''[[Horkeliella]]'' – false horkelias (sometimes in ''Potentilla''<ref name=potter/>) * ''[[Ivesia]]'' – mousetails (sometimes in ''Potentilla'') {{col-2-of-2}} * ''[[Kerria (plant)|Kerria]]'' – Kerria * ''[[Leucosidea]]'' – Oldwood * ''[[Marcetella]]'' * ''[[Margyricarpus]]'' – Pearlfruit * ''[[Polylepis]]'' * ''[[Potaninia]]''<ref name=potter/> * ''[[Potentilla]]'' – typical cinquefoils (including ''Duchesnea'') * ''[[Poteridium]]''<ref name=potter/> * ''[[Poterium]]'' * ''[[Purpusia]]'' * ''[[Rhodotypos]]'' – Jetbead * ''[[Rose|Rosa]]'' – roses * ''[[Rubus]]'' – brambles * ''[[Sanguisorba]]'' – burnets * ''[[Sarcopoterium]]'' * ''[[Sibbaldia]]''<ref name=potter/> * ''[[Sibbaldianthe]]'' * ''[[Sibbaldiopsis]]'' – Three-toothed Cinquefoil (formerly in ''Potentilla'') * ''[[Sieversia]]''<ref name=potter/> * ''[[Spenceria]]'' * ''[[Stellariopsis]]'' (sometimes in ''Potentilla''<ref name=potter/>) * ''[[Tetraglochin]]'' * ''[[Waldsteinia]]'' (sometimes in ''Geum''<ref name=potter/>) {{col-end}} </div> ==Footnotes== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Rosaceae]] [[Category:Rosoideae| ]] [[Category:Plant subfamilies]] {{Rosales-stub}}
